title: Payments by Honolulu accountants
context: §40-32 Payments by Honolulu accountants. Every public accountant collecting or receiving revenue or other moneys in Honolulu shall pay weekly, or at such times as may be otherwise specially appointed, into the treasury all sums of money collected or received by the public accountant on account of the revenue or otherwise. [L 1898, c 39, §30; RL 1925, §1441; am L 1927, c 219, §4; RL 1935, §568; RL 1945, §1572; RL 1955, §34-21; am L 1957, c 152, §1; HRS §40-32; am L 1975, c 73, §1; gen ch 1985] Case Notes Failure to dispose of money as required, is a breach. 16 H. 123. Includes money paid under protest pending litigation. 17 H. 364.
